segment.tokens: The brown bear much resembles the black in size , habits and shape
The brown bear like it
The brown bear lives in hollow places
he however sometimes digs pits for himself
he even constructs huts he lines with moss
Both attain an enormous size weight
All bears are extremely of honey and sugar
All bears are often taken when venturing too to man to procure these enticing substances
The settlers in Canada when they make maple sugar
The settlers in Canada catch them leaving a boiler full their head
by leaving a boiler full , into which they dip their paws , or their head
they fall an easy prey
when encumbered with the thick , saccharine matter sometimes the boiler also
Bruin attention is easily diverted
many have escaped throwing a bundle knapsack down
when he is in pursuit of them
while he stoops to examine it
for they gain time distance
It is to him to play all sorts of antics
we are told an Indian traveller
that in one of his journeys some bears kept of his palanquin
tumbling
playing
as if they designed to afford him amusement
Climbing is a great to them
one was seen to ascend a scaffolding for his own pleasure
he at first proceeded cautiously
examining the strength of all the joists
he at last reached the summit twenty feet high
the summit was hundred twenty feet high
He looked
much pleased
when he had completed this operation
the workmen treated him with great civility
They were going to lower him in a bucket
to this he would not consent
he descended
as he had mounted
that he repeated his visit
A Norwegian had tamed a bear so completely
that he used to stand at the back of his master 's sledge , where he kept so good a balance
where he kept so good a balance
that it was to upset him
if the sledge went on one side
the bear threw his weight in the opposite direction
the bear kept up the equilibrium
One day however his master in sport drove over the worst ground he could find
he could find
hoping to throw the bear off
This however only served to irritate him
he vented his ill humour giving his master a tremendous blow across the shoulders
A countryman in Russia when seeking honey climbed a very high tree
the trunk which was
finding
there was a large quantity of comb in it
he descended
he stuck fast in the tenacious substance there deposited
there deposited
He was so far from home
that his voice could not be heard
he remained two days in this situation
relieving his hunger with the honey
He began to despair
ever being extricated
a bear like himself came for the sake of the honey
when a bear slid down the hollow hind part foremost
The man of his alarm seized hold of him
as he could
dragging the man up with him
the bear also in a great fright , clambered out as fast as he could , dragging the man up with him , and when clear of his tail-bearer made off as fast as possible
The drollest most accomplished of all bears was the celebrated of Paris
whose dancing climbing curtsying tumbling begging many other antics were the of every child in the metropolis , and of many grown-up children also
It is
that the nursemaids endangered the lives of their charges holding them over the side of the pit in which he was kept
over the side of the pit in which he was kept
as none _ did _ fall
they continued to amuse themselves their nurslings at the same risk
One morning early he very cleverly withdrew the bolts of his pit door
he sallied forth on his hind-legs to take a walk
The keepers of the garden had not risen
the dogs were on the alert , and surrounded Martin , jumping and barking , half in play , and half in earnest
jumping
barking
This roused
what was the
the men rushing out to see beheld the bear in the midst of the canine troop his tongue an expression of fun and enjoyment in his countenance , which was indescribable
lolling of his mouth
out
his countenance was
Never was the malignant so
often noticed in bears pulling the nictating membrane third eyelid half over the eye , seen in poor Martin 's face
seen in poor Martin 's face
yet he became unpopular from the cupidity of one of the sentinels
This man fancied
he saw a five-franc piece
lying in the bear 's pit
This man determined to go during the night
when he would be on duty
secure it
He accordingly provided himself with a ladder
when the guard was changed
was found
lying lifeless at the bottom , the coveted piece in his hand , which proved to be nothing but a large button
the bottom the coveted piece in his hand proved a large button
No marks of violence were to be seen upon his body
the contusions on his head seemed to tell
that he had fallen from the ladder when near the top
he so met his death
Whether he had been
he seized with giddiness
whether Martin had shaken the ladder
no one could say
the animal was sitting quietly by his side
when his fate was first made
known
The story fled like wildfire from one end of Paris to the other
in a short time the populace were fully
that Martin had killed him
combined with other exaggerations
this induced them to flock in multitudes to see the murderous bear
wrapped up in some sweet substance
Afterwards two balls of arsenic were found in the pit
fortunately before Martin had touched them
the authorities of the establishment thought it prudent to remove him to a den in the menagerie
The front of these dens was closed at night with a sliding shutter
pulled down inserting a hook at the end of a long pole into a ring
when the shutter was down
which ring served to admit a bolt
This did not at all please Martin
the keeper never could accomplish the fastening
till some one else went to the other side to take off the bear attention
for the moment the shutter was down
Martin inserted his claws
Martin pushed it up again
this practice was continued as long
as he existed
